availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, teacher. Virginia native. Married to Mildred C. Sayre. Father of Virginia Sayre and Elizabeth Sayre. Teacher in Frankfort in 1850 and 1860. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 56; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 103.; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 15-6; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 37; The Frankfort Roundabout (Frankfort, Ky.), "December 17, 1892, p. 1; Find A Grave, "B. B. Sayre (1810-1879)," Memorial #70371196, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=70371196&ref=acom (accessed May 5, 2017).
